Description: Fragment of pink calcite: with part of the prenomen of Merenptah. The surviving fragment is worn in places. There are traces of blue inlay in the hieroglyphs.
Curator's comments: For another fragment from the same site, see 1849,0811.211a-b. Bibliography: J. D. Cooney, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 58 (1972), 284; K.A. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' Vol. 7 (Oxford: Blackwell Press), 217.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1982 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 10. (pl.24)
Condition: fair (incomplete). The surviving fragment is worn in places.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj Charles Kerr Macdonald
Additional IDs: Other BM number: EA13370 (original Big Number)
